newsitem.title: GERMANY: Mercedes Benz plans to lift truck production.
newsitem.headline: Mercedes Benz plans to lift truck production.

text.p: Mercedes-Benz AG said it plans to increase truck production to over 400,000 units over the medium term from 330,000 units in 1995, Chairman Helmut Werner said on Wednesday.
The car and truck maker, which was showing its new line of heavy trucks at the race track here, said it expected its new Actros model to add around 500 million marks ($339.1 million) to profits.
Mercedes, which along with other truck makers, has had difficulty coping with weak demand in west Europe.

But Werner said efforts to improve profitability are in full swing, including a reduction in labour costs. He said he expected talks with the labour force will find a way to cut costs without hurting employment levels. ($1=1.4747 Mark)
